contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox District DE |name=Ostvorpommern |image_coa=Wappen Landkreis Ostvorpommern.svg |state=Mecklenburg-Vorpommern |capital=[[Anklam]] |area=1899 |Kreisschlüssel = | population=105036 | population_as_of=2010-12-31 |carsign=OVP |founded = 1994 |dissolved = 2011 |url=http://www.kreis-ovp.de |map=Locator map OVP in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern.svg |Landrat = }} '''Ostvorpommern''' was a ''Kreis'' (district) in the eastern part of [[Mecklenburg-Vorpommern]], [[Germany]]. The district was created on June 12, 1994 by merging the former districts of Anklam, Greifswald and Wolgast. It was merged into [[Vorpommern-Greifswald]] on 4 September 2011. Neighboring districts were (from east clockwise) [[Uecker-Randow]], [[Mecklenburg-Strelitz (district)|Mecklenburg-Strelitz]], [[Demmin (district)|Demmin]] and [[Nordvorpommern]]. The [[Hanseatic League|Hanseatic]] city of [[Greifswald]] was enclosed by the district, but did not belong to it. ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Landkreis Ostvorpommern.svg|130px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms shows the [[griffin]] of Pomerania. |} ==Towns and municipalities== The subdivisions of the district were (situation August 2011): {| |----- !''Amt''-free towns||''Amt''-free municipalities |- |valign=top| #[[Anklam]] |valign=top| #[[Heringsdorf, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern|Heringsdorf]] |} {| ! colspan=3|[[Amt (country subdivision)|Ämter]] |- valign=top || *'''1. [[Am Peenestrom]]''' #[[Buggenhagen]] #[[Hohendorf]] #[[Krummin]] #[[Lassan, Germany|Lassan]]<sup>2</sup> #[[Lütow]] #[[Sauzin]] #[[Wolgast]]<sup>1, 2</sup> #[[Zemitz]] *'''2. [[Anklam-Land]]''' #[[Bargischow]] #[[Blesewitz]] #[[Boldekow]] #[[Bugewitz]] #[[Butzow]] #[[Ducherow]] #[[Iven]] #[[Krien]] #[[Krusenfelde]] #[[Liepen]] #[[Medow]] #[[Neetzow]] #[[Neu Kosenow]] #[[Neuendorf A]] #[[Neuendorf B]] #[[Neuenkirchen, Anklam-Land|Neuenkirchen]] #[[Postlow]] #[[Putzar]] #[[Rossin]] #[[Sarnow]] #[[Spantekow]]<sup>1</sup> #[[Stolpe, Ostvorpommern|Stolpe]] || *'''3. [[Lubmin (Amt)|Lubmin]]''' #[[Brünzow]] #[[Hanshagen]] #[[Katzow]] #[[Kemnitz]] #[[Kröslin]] #[[Loissin]] #[[Lubmin]]<sup>1</sup> #[[Neu Boltenhagen]] #[[Rubenow]] #[[Wusterhusen]] *'''5. [[Züssow (Amt)|Züssow]]''' #[[Bandelin]] #[[Gribow]] #[[Groß Kiesow]] #[[Groß Polzin]] #[[Gützkow]]<sup>2</sup> #[[Karlsburg, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern|Karlsburg]] #[[Klein Bünzow]] #[[Kölzin]] #[[Lühmannsdorf]] #[[Murchin]] #[[Rubkow]] #[[Schmatzin]] #[[Wrangelsburg]] #[[Ziethen]] #[[Züssow]]<sup>1</sup> |- |colspan=3 align=center|<sup>1</sup>seat of the Amt; <sup>2</sup>town |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Landkreis Ostvorpommern}} * [http://www.kreis-ovp.de Official website] (German) * [http://www.usedom.de Touristic website of Usedom] (English, German, Polish) * [http://www.vorpommern.de Regional Tourist Board Vorpommern] (English, German, Swedish, Polish) {{Germany districts mecklenburg-western pomerania}} {{Pomerania}} {{Coord|53.93|13.67|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Former districts of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern]]
